titles.title: Unemployment Trust Fund Accountability Act
Unemployment Trust Fund Accountability Act

To direct each State with an outstanding balance in excess of $1,000,000,000, as of January 1, 2023, of advances from the Federal unemployment account to submit to the Secretary of Labor a report detailing how such State intends to repay such advances.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Work and Welfare.

bill.summary:
Unemployment Trust Fund Accountability Act
This bill requires any state that received advances from the Federal Unemployment Account in the Unemployment Trust Fund and owes more than $1 billion as of January 1, 2023, to report on how the state intends to repay the funds. The report must be provided to Congress and the Department of Labor no later than 90 days after the bill's enactment.
